title: (x) Looking for a paperclip glyph {Raph}
content:
I’m looking for a glyph shaped like a paperclip  
because it would be nice to display a paperclip onscreen  
without having to use use an image file.

Does one exist in any open-source or microsoft core font?  
The closest thing i can find resembling a paperclip is  
Unicode 06E9, the ‘Arabic Place of Sajdah’ glyph.
author: snsh

comments.content: Here ya go: [PaperClip.ttf](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111042922/http:/levien.com/type/myfonts/PaperClip.ttf). It’s in the @ symbol position, which seemed somehow appropriate.

Some more…

http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/klipjoint/  
http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/day-job/  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/poppi/office-one/](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111042922/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/poppi/office-one/)

No paperclip in Unicode as far as I’m aware - I don’t think we have one in any core font, although i could be wrong.

Si
